comment: Super organized and structure. Lots of resources. Tests are application based but not too hard. She seems sweet. Class included some extra credit and dropped assignment. Overall, pretty good.

Dr. C's class is very hard.  The lectures, homework, study guides do not match up the exams or quizzes.  One test was over a chapter that we had not studied yet.  I made it out with an A, but that is due to extra credit.  She isn't very responsive when you email her with a question and it seems as though you are "bothering" her.

They cram too much material into the class. VERY test heavy, 5 exams in total. HW and quiz due pretty much every single week. Quizzes use lockdown browser + webcam, and you have 2 attempts. I would say do ALL of the extra credit. It boosted my grade around 10 points in total, it was the only reason I had an A even though I failed 4/5 exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy

comment: Dr. C is a great teacher who is more than willing to help and provide resources to help you be successful in this course. However, the course is difficult and test heavy (5 exams with 400 out of 1000 total points coming from exams.) As long as you watch the lectures, take notes, and make flashcards of key terms, you should be able to do well.

Biology is very tough. This class is no different because of the pacing. However, do all of your homework and it really helps your grade even if you don't do well on quizzes and exams. There are quizzes every week and the discussion boards are easy. Everything is in lockdown browser. Overall, the pacing is what makes this class difficult.

I recommend to take it in-person as online is so much harder. I find that a lot of the material (and there is so much) is not exactly on the tests and/or quizzes in the same way you may study them in the hw. So much to read, so much to learn, and hard to follow. Also, the spacing of some quizzes and exams doesn't give you much time to study.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Tests were difficult, not similar to the study guides.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Wasn't a bad professor, just kind of takes a while to respond to emails. Most of your grade comes from the exams. If you're good with independently learning, I'd suggest her.

I took this course online. There were weekly tests (you have 2 attempts) and then exams every once in a while. I often found that some of the material I studied did not match up on most of the exams and some tests. It was a struggle but I ended up passing the class. If you already have knowledge on biology take her course.

I mean, multiple extra credit opportunities, drop lowest discussion and 2 lowest quizzes, very communicative. Hard to go wrong with that. All quizzes and tests are lockdown so remember that. I think I would've enjoyed this class so much more if I liked biology more.
Very good online class, was very straight forward and was very willing to work with my group. I feel she respected us which was nice.

Had her online class for the summer semester, it a pretty straightforward and easy course. You have two labs per week which are not time consuming, plus two big projects. Very caring and respectful especially when she responds to emails regarding questions or concerns. I highly recommend her for online lab!!

Dr. Cuya-Smith's class was by far one of the best I have taken. I took the online course and it could have not been any easier. Not much work outside of the weekly labs. There is 2 "big" projects during the semester that take no longer than a day to complete. 10/10 class and professsor.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Doesn't give good feedback on assignments. Isn't understanding about assignments but wants us to be understanding about her... Probably won't take again.

She's not a bad person but her lectures are kind of bad. She is a very smart woman, but it seems like because she is so smart it is harder for her to really get her words out in a way someone not so smart can understand. She does give a million opportunities to improve your grade and she is always available to chat if needed.

If you don't take Dr. C for lab you're so missing out. Very caring professor whose willing to answer ever the most basic questions and doesn't get upset if you need even more clarification. This was my first lab and I'm happy to have taken her. Easy A as long as you put effort in and communicate with her.

Great person yet not the best at teaching this class. The material wasn't hard but the test difficulty was above what was taught in class. Could come off as snarky/rude sometimes. If you put in the effort and come to class then making a decent grade is not impossible. Highly recommend coming to class since she does in-class assignments often.

Dr. C was overall a nice professor although she was very unwilling to accommodate students and could often come off as rude. Deadlines are set in stone. Power points are confusing with lots of typos and tests are pretty challenging. She doesn't curve but offers extra credit. 87.5 is an A.

BIOL 3410
Dr. C is amazing! really wants you to understand, tests are hard but if you go to class she will tell you all the questions basically. she encourages questions, and the tests aren't memory but concept based. it's always multiple choice, short answer, and an essay
she will give in-class assignments for extra credit
Dr. Cuya- Smith is my favorite professor ever. She's so funny, relatable, and very understanding. She genuinely cares for her students.

Professor Cuya genuinely cares about her students. For the first few minutes of class she would ask us about other classes and how they were going. While the grading is a little strict to the rubric, she's lenient and is very funny. Half of the classes were guest speakers and the other half was mostly group work. Easy A in my opinion!

I took her CSM2000 course. Dr. C is really funny and she cares about how your other classes are going and is willing to help you with whatever she can. There are a good amount of papers and assignments but find a good group (you will be with for the rest of the semester) and you guys will get it done together. Would take again if it were BIO.
She places you in groups of 3 or 4 to work on weekly assignments. Class involves performing lab with digital worksheets with clear instructions. She will help you if you ask questions.

Dr. C is a great professor. She's very relatable and upfront about what she expects from the class. Her assignments are fair, but some of the deadlines can come up very quickly so definitely be aware of that. She's overall a great person and wants to see her students succeed. Would recommend.
gives lots of group projects but is a nice person who actually cares about her students

Dr. Cuya-Smith was fantastic. She always makes sure that the labs line up with what you're doing in the biology lecture and is extremely patient and willing to help. She gives ample time for quizzes and labs and there are tons of opportunities for extra credit at the end of the semester. She's very personable and connects with her students well.

By far one of my best college experiences. She was a fantastic professor! One that very much understood that college students are loaded down with class and jobs. I beyond appreciated her and her class, and would take any class she taught. Always made my day when I had her class!
I loved Dr. C. She literally made my 8AM classes worth going to. Also, she is so thorough when she explains what she teaches. Take her if you can!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria

comment: She was very nice, funny, and really cares about wanting you to understand and pass the class. She does curse a bit, lol, but that was fine with me. She gives as many points as she can, and gives lots of extra credit. The good news is that there is only one exam, so you just need to work hard once. Overall I would take her again :)

I hadn't taken a lab in 4 years and Dr.C was everything I could've wished for coming into this class. She is very knowledgeable and genuinely cares about her students. She does joke and cuss quite a bit, so if you don't have a sense of humor I would suggest another professor. Quiz due before every lab, just read through the worksheet.
-Other Grace

You will pass if you attend class. The quizzes aren't too difficult, and if you study properly, you should be able to pass them. She isn't a harsh grader at all; she genuinely cares about every one of her students, and she is a joy to learn from. I will, without a doubt, enroll in another class with her!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: She is really understanding, and also guarantees that if you show up to class, you will pass with a b or higher. Participation is important, and the tasks and tests aren't difficult. If I'm being honest, you don't need to study for anything because everything is so simple. She is not at all harsh, and she is also amusing.

Absolutely love Dr.C shes very hands on when it comes to our labs she makes sure we understand everything shes very good at her job. Shes kind of loud and she also doesnt play shes serious about lab so if youre not ready to learn dont take this class. Overall she helped me a lot.

She is a tough teacher but she cares a LOT and is always willing to help. If you have a poor work ethic, don't respond well to constructive criticism, or want a high school level course over a college one then don't take her. Her grading criteria are clear and she is more than fair, but you have to earn the grade. She's genuine and hilarious too.

I had this professor for my biology lab and it was kinda hard. She is very vague when she is explaining the lab which makes it very challenging. When you ask questions she makes you feel dumb. (profanity warning) so avoid this class if you are sensitive to language. She cusses a lot I would not recommend this professor to anyone that I cared about.

I loved her. Everything was laid out in the syllabus, usually extended deadlines, loved to hear us talk about our problems, and was extremely caring. As long as you come to class and you completed all assignments/group assignments then you'll pass the class with a 100. She literally explained everything to you. It's impossible to fail.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Hilarious

comment: Dr. C was super kind and understanding. She provided a zoom if you couldnt make it to class in person & the majority of the work was group work. A good bit of projects but every assignment was super easy. She allowed for class discussions and always helped us with our bio & life issues. Definitely one of the best professors you could get.

I had Dr. C for Culture of Science and Math and she was amazing!! There are a lot of assignments but at least half of them are group projects and are not hard. And Dr. C is more than willing to help you with your understanding of the material. She also helped me study for another class for 3+ hours. She genuinely wants to see students succeed.

IDK about Bio, but I took Dr.C fall of 2021 for SCM & BEST PROFESSOR EVER! During SCM, we have open class discussions where we get to share our feelings with her, talk about our lives, open up to her, & it feels like therapy. She's VERY understanding & her assignments are all completion grade. Easy A if you do your work & show up to class.

I don't get why there Dr. C has low ratings. I took her for a hybrid summer bio lab and it was super easy. As long and you pay attention during lab and read the worksheets it's a very easy class. All quizzes and most exams have 2 attempts, lab worksheets are completion grades, and then the big poster project. That's it!

I took this online class when COVID hit, it is group oriented and attendance and participation matter to her, she was very helpful because I was failing and let me submit work. She is interactive with us and gives her Honest opinion/feedback. No cap I really appreciate her for helping me pass the class, just put in the research for assignments
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Really nice and answers questions. Approachable and responds to emails. Homework is time consuming but not too complex. There are group assignments, so beware. End of semester she offers some extra credit. Every week there is homework, quiz, and assignment that may or may not b group work. There is a textbook, but u don't need it to pass the class.

Dr. C is awesome! She is the most understanding professor I have ever met. She is so genuine. She's an easy grader, quick to respond to emails, and has really interesting lectures. She helps prepare you for the future. Take her if you get the chance, you won't regret it. She leaves a lasting positive impression on her students.

LOVE HER. She cares about her students mental health, and checked in weekly. Idk abt her bio classes but she was the best in this class. Miss more than 5 classes and automatically fail. She is really understanding and wants her students to succeed. I recommend for SCM2000
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Hilarious

comment: The powerpoints were not specific, read the powerpoints out loud and didn't go into much more detail than that. I took the course in Spring 2020 when COVID hit so, we ended up online and she didn't care that there was a pandemic and everyone was struggling. I tried to reach out for help but felt pushed aside. There is SO much online homework. AVOID
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: I had her for SCM2000 and I can honestly say that she cares alot about her students. Shes a very nice teacher and really sweet. In addition she is really laid back and most of the time gives extra time to complete projects. Although she is really nice, I would not take her for a biology class. I have heard that her biology classes are not so great

Professor Cuya-Smith is one of the sweetest professors i've had. She really cares for her students and is there to talk if you need her. Her SCM2000 class is very easy. There is a fair amount of group projects and assignments, but you don't have to learn anything to complete them. This class is just busy work, but great if you need a GPA booster!

I love Dr.C so much, she really cares for her students and wants to see then succeed. She was not my teacher for biology, but she encouraged me to stick in there and helped me to pass the class. She really cares about her students as individuals and wants to see them succeed all around.

I absolutely loved her and her class. it's very clear that she cares about her students and makes sure to check in on them at the beginning of every class. I think the workload was fair, and she isn't a tough grader. I recommend!

I had her online and it's obvious she cares about her students. There was a lot of work but it wasn't hard and she answers questions well so that everyone understands. She's sorta funny and relates to students well.

Best Professor Ive had. Shes super caring and grades pretty easy. She also is very good at answering emails in timely manor and getting students feedback on each assignment. Doesnt assign a lot of homework at all and theres no quizzes or tests only group projects.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: Shes a great person, but when it comes to teaching shes just terrible. Avoid at all cost!
Avoid. Her tests were really hard. She uses lockdown browser plus webcam. Her lectures are long. Tough grader.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: Reads powerpoints for lectures and has TA answer any student questions. Horrible attitude and not great at explaining concepts. Avoid taking this professor if possible!

Lockdown Browser for online. Quizzes match chapter quizzes. LOOK AT PRACTICE EXAM TO PASS EXAMS-very similar content. A lot of online homework but easy to pass that. Doesnt give chances so be on time with work. Book more helpful than the lectures. Access code for HW was free at least.

Dr. Cuya-Smith's introductory biology course is one of most challenging courses I have had so far, but I learned alot. It is definitely a lot harder than I expected, but she teaches the material in a fair and interesting way. I definitely had to put forward a lot of time to study the material, but I never felt that it was unfair or impossible.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: tests are not related and each time its two times harder. read powerpoints for lecture. Honestly did not learn a thing from the class. waste of money and time. even reading the book she provided did not help me . I really wish someone else was teach me this class. Please take someone else if you can. I cannot be more honest than this about this.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: TERRIBLE!! Her lectures are just her reading off powerpoint slides, and expects you to retain this knowledge. Get ready to read the book over, and over, and lots of mastering biology study modules. Her practice exams, and study sessions often do not reflect the material on the test so be aware!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: She does not teach at all and is a terrible test giver. There was one test where 53% of the class failed (D or lower) and she did absolutely nothing; there was no curve and she only gave back 6 points out of a 150 point test. The whole class is point based and only out of 800 points. Very hard to get an A with the way she grades and formats class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: This teacher is quite honestly the biggest disappointment Ive ever had my entire time at KSU. Her incompetence is only matched by her failure to articulate instruction and her horrible attitude. It is completely lost on me how she got a PhD in Biology when she doesnt seem to be able to function as a human. Dont take her. Tests are impossible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: If you have an ounce of will to live in you, avoid this class at all costs. I wish I dropped her but it was too late. Don't let it be too late for you.
Just dont. Save yourself the headache, and just dont take her

Dr. Cuya-Smith is a very knowledgable professor, she will help you in her office if youre struggling. She does care about her students even though she can be rude and it doesnt seem like it. To make an A in this class read every chapter assigned ( 4-5 per test) and study. NGL you have to put in the effort but I made an A so you can too!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Not the best professor to take as she does not teach anything by herself. I am taking her in Summer 2020 online and most of her lecutres are taught by her TA. Her test as no where near the lecture or the practice exam. She thinks we can learn everything by ourself as we are graduates in Biology.

DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS. I personally had bad experience with her and she has an very bad attitude while emailing me back also on a question. As far as class goes, she really does not care if we understand anything or not because she thinks that we all are master in biology. Her test are super hard and she does not give proper notes. DO NOT TAKE HER.

Very easy lab. This class was much easier than the lecture that was also taught by her. The most important projects were posters about the labs. The labs were very easy to understand and, if you have any questions, she is always there to answer.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Group projects--Gives good feedback

comment: Not bad at teaching or explaining the course, but it doesn't reflect the exams she gave. Keep in mind I took the 2 of the 4 exams before quarantine, so I did way better online than in person. This is not the class for those who have a problem with memorization, the hardest thing was learning all the different enzymes for cellular respiration...
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Would not recommend. Took her for Bio 1 and she thought it like a upper level or graduate class. All her test are extremely hard, she gives practice questions that are nothing like the test. I would study weeks before the test and still fail. Before online our class test averages were Fs.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: She's a great professor but her tests are very book heavy. If you want to do well on tests, take detailed notes for each chapter because not everything is covered in the lecture.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Participation matters

comment: The grades are always posted in a reasonable amount of time. If you do not show up to class you will be left behind. She tries her best to help you if you try to see her outside of class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT
